title: Why House Republicans Can’t Unite in Speaker Saga
description: The Republican free-for-all for speaker reflects a web of overlapping blocs that have made the party nearly ungovernable.

title: U.S. Raises Concerns About Israel’s Plan of Action in Gaza, Officials Say
description: The Pentagon has sent officers to help the Israelis with the challenges of fighting an urban war.

title: With War in Israel, the Cancel Culture Debate Comes Full Circle
description: We’re in an especially repressive period for free speech.

title: Gaza Invasion Delays Raise Questions in Israel
description: So pervasive is the pall of chaos in Israel’s government that top officials saw fit to assure a traumatized public that they are “working in close and full cooperation, around the clock.”

title: The Secret of America’s Economic Success
description: We’ve done amazingly well, even if people won’t believe it.

title: Hamas Released Two More Hostages
description: Also, Stephen Sondheim’s last musical opens in New York. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.

title: Menendez Pleads Not Guilty to Plotting to Be an Agent of Egypt
description: Senator Robert Menendez, a Democrat, was arraigned on Monday in Manhattan federal court. It was his second appearance there in a month.

title: 5 Takeaways from Argentina’s Election
description: Javier Milei, a libertarian economist often compared to Donald Trump, will face off against Sergio Massa, Argentina’s economy minister, in a runoff next month.

title: Gavin Newsom Wants to Export California’s Climate Laws to the World
description: The Democratic governor is supercharging climate policy and eyeing a future White House run. But critics say some of his constituents could be left behind.

title: Off-Duty Pilot Tries to Disrupt Engines on Alaska Airlines Flight
description: The flight was diverted to Portland, Ore., because of a “credible security threat” inside the cockpit, the airline said. An off-duty pilot was charged with attempted murder.

title: Turkey’s President Sends Sweden’s NATO Bid to Parliament for Ratification
description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan had been holding out on approval of Sweden’s application. It’s unclear why he is now moving it forward.

title: Flight of the Drones Lights Up Central Park
description: The Drift collaborative orchestrated a performance art piece with light-emitting drones that mimic swarming starlings or fish — but mostly slow-motion fireworks.

title: What Happened When Fake Trump Signs Appeared in Greenwich, Connecticut
description: The placards were up in a wealthy town up for less than a day. The fight over them lasted years.

title: U.A.W. Expands Strike to a Ram Plant in Michigan
description: The United Automobile Workers union called on 6,800 workers to walk off the job at a large factory that makes one of Stellantis’s most profitable vehicles.

title: How Lionel Messi Made a Pink Jersey Soccer’s Must-Have Item
description: In the span of three months, the soccer superstar has made Inter Miami’s eye-catching jersey the hottest piece of sports merchandise on the planet.

title: This Israeli-Hamas War Has Smashed Comforting Assumptions
description: Some paradigms taken for granted about Israel and the Palestinians, both in Gaza and the West Bank, have been broken. So has the idea that Washington can ignore the Middle East.

title: Fight for Speaker Reveals Four Types of House Republicans
description: Jim Jordan’s bid showed the power of the ultraconservative faction in Congress.

title: Chevron to Acquire Hess for $53 Billion in Latest Major Oil Deal
description: The acquisition marks further consolidation of the oil industry and highlights the confidence that energy companies have in the future of fossil fuels.

title: A Delayed Invasion
description: Why the U.S. wants Israel to pause a ground invasion in Gaza.

title: Editors’ Note: Gaza Hospital Coverage
description: The Times’s initial accounts of the blast attributed the claim of Israeli responsibility to Palestinian officials, and noted that the Israeli military said it was investigating the blast. However, the early versions of the coverage relied too heavily on claims by Hamas.

title: The Problem With a $2 Trillion Deficit
description: The growing deficit has been at the center of the fight over choosing a House speaker.

title: The People Who Broke the House
description: As the House speaker crisis drags on into a fourth week, a look at some of the Republicans who have mired the country in this mess.

title: If Trump Trial Isn’t Broadcast Live, a Plea to Record It for Posterity
description: A request to broadcast one of Donald Trump’s federal trials made an intriguing backup argument, one rooted not in the news cycle but in ensuring a complete historical record.

title: Developing World Sees Double Standard in West’s Actions in Gaza and Ukraine
description: Resentments are complicating calls by the Biden administration to rally the world against efforts to “annihilate” democracies.

title: Republicans Grapple With Being Speakerless, but Effectively Leaderless, Too
description: With a speaker fight in the House, concerns about an aging Senate leader and a 2024 front-runner who has the party in a vise grip, some G.O.P. members worry the turmoil could have long-term effects.

title: Why the World Is Watching Iran
description: As Iran rages over the mounting casualties in Gaza, fears are growing that its on-again-off-again proxy war with Israel will break out into a sustained conflict.

title: The 25 Best Restaurants in Philadelphia
description: The dining scene here is having a moment, whether it’s outstanding pizza, fiery Ethiopian fried chicken or French inflected cuisine that feels like a cozy dinner party.

title: Psychedelic Mushrooms Hit the Market in Oregon
description: The state has pioneered a therapeutic market for psychedelic mushrooms. Researchers are watching with a mix of excitement and unease.

title: Alzheimer’s and the Paradox of Advance Directives
description: It is hard to know in advance what kind of existence you’ll be content with.

title: Grade Inflation Needs to Stop
description: Grade inflation acts just like real inflation.

title: The Blind Ambition of Chris Christie
description: The former New Jersey governor is a uniquely flawed foil for Donald Trump, compromised in ways that blunt his most effective attacks.

title: Stone By Ancient Stone, Mexico Recovers Its Lost Treasures
description: In recent years Mexico has mounted an ambitious series of investigations and restitution efforts to correct decades of theft and colonial plundering.

title: Five Places to Visit in Dakar, Senegal, With Singer Baaba Maal
description: The Senegalese singer-songwriter known as the “voice of Wakanda” from the “Black Panther” films recommends sites to see in the place where he found his own voice.

title: How High Interest Rates Sting Bakers, Farmers and Consumers
description: Everyone who relies on credit in America is confronting a new reality: Money will cost more for a good long while.

title: A Project Supporting Migrants Was Cost Effective. Why Did It End?
description: Britain tested an alternative to detention for people living outside the immigration system. Though praised by the U.N., its outcomes didn’t fit the government’s hard-line approach.

title: Hamas Fails to Make Case That Israel Struck Hospital
description: A senior Hamas official says “nothing is left” of the munition that hit the Ahli Arab hospital in Gaza City last week, killing hundreds. Israel says the explosion was caused by a misfired Palestinian rocket.
